conclusion: Given data includes lengths of sides, angles, resistivity, cross-sectional area, electromotive force, and magnetic induction intensity.
The length of the sides AB, BC, and CD is L.
Since AB = BC = CD = L, the length of each side is L.
The side AD is the base of an equilateral triangle formed by the sides AB, BC, and CD. Therefore, the length of AD is also L.
The total length of the wire is the sum of the lengths of all the sides: L + L + L + L = 4L.
The resistance of the wire is given by the formula: R = œÅL/S.
The current flowing through the wire is given by the formula: I = E/R.
The force acting on each side of the frame is given by the formula: F = BIL.
The resultant force acting on the frame is the vector sum of the forces acting on each side of the frame.
The force acting on side AB is: FAB = BIL.
The force acting on side BC is: FBC = BIL.
The force acting on side CD is: FCD = BIL.
The force acting on side AD is: FAD = BIL.
The resultant force acting on the frame is: Fresultant = FAB + FBC + FCD + FAD = 4BIL.
The direction of the resultant force is perpendicular to the plane of the frame, and it is directed towards the left.
The magnitude of the resultant force acting on the frame is 4BIL, and its direction is perpendicular to the plane of the frame, directed towards the left.
